result.markdown:
# BA Examples

Simulate BA data.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1)

time <- 50
params_ba_true <- list(
  mu = 0.5,
  K = 0.5,
  beta = 0.5,
  beta_edges = 2
)

sim <- sim_hawkesNet(
  params = params_ba_true,
  T_end = time,
  mark_type = "ba"
)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "Simulation took 0.72 seconds"
```


:::
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(sim$net)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](examples_ba_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
print(paste("Number of simulated nodes:", nrow(sim$ev$nodes)))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "Number of simulated nodes: 236"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
paste("Number of simulated edges:", nrow(sim$ev$edges))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "Number of simulated edges: 235"
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
paste("Number of simulated events:", sim$events$n)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "Number of simulated events: 236"
```


:::
:::


:::callout-note
After tweaking with the parameters a bit, it seems that the number of edges is
usually just directly proportional to the number of nodes. Is this a sign 
something is wrong?
:::

Fit BA data.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
params_ba_init <- list(
  mu = 1,
  K = 1,
  beta = 1,
  beta_edges = 1
)

fit <- fit_hawkesNet(
      ev = sim$ev,
      params_init = params_ba_init,
      mark_type = "ba"
    )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "Fitting took 86.9 seconds"
```


:::
:::


Parameter values on the fitted scale:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
unlist(fit$par)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
        mu          K       beta beta_edges 
 0.8502838  0.4381081  0.4946193  2.0018328 
```


:::
:::


Not too bad.

And, we can also grab parameter values on the transformed scale:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Yes I know this is a jank way to structure it right now, will fix
fit$fit$par
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
        mu          K       beta beta_edges 
-0.1621852 -0.8252896 -0.7039668  0.6940632 
```


:::
:::
